folder: Emmons Avenue & Coyle Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Emmons Ave., east from Coyle to Bragg Streets, showing the Plumb Beach Casino, demolished about 1928, which was the dancing and dining establishment for the bathers and picnickers in this area.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Emmons Avenue & Coyle Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Emmons Ave., south side, opposite Coyle Street, showing Beau Rivage, owned by Gulotti and Vannini in 1922 and by W.E. Morson and Popper in 1925.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Emmons Avenue & Coyle Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Emmons Avenue, south side, east from Coyle Street; view 2 is east from Bragg Street.

June 13, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
